1.brief: as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

2.brief: as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
to place (in a very wide application)
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
where?; hence, whither?, when?; also hither and thither
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

3.brief: to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
properly, to be slack or languid, i.e. (by implication) sleep (figuratively, to die); also to grow old, stale or inveterate
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin

4.brief: properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall

5.brief: kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
something saved, i.e. (abstractly) deliverance; hence, aid, victory, prosperity
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to treat a person (well or ill), i.e. benefit or requite; by implication (of toil), to ripen, i.e. (specifically) to wean
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
